title: jiya83095
author: jiya83095
content: The main question asked these days are “how to withdraw money from crypto.com?”The procedure is given below in steps form.Visit crypto.com application form.Now you have to link your bank accountThen press transfer, and click the balance once before proceedingThen you have two option one is deposit and other is withdraw.Then select withdrawThen again  you will have two choices one is crypto other is fiat.You have to choose fiatThen click on withdraw fiat to bank accountNow click on preferred currencyFill out the amountClick on withdrawConfirm itWithdrawal process complete.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: jiya83095 on May 16, 2023, 05:53:37 AMThe main question asked these days are “how to withdraw money from crypto.com?”The procedure is given below in steps form.Visit crypto.com application form.Now you have to link your bank accountThen press transfer, and click the balance once before proceedingThen you have two option one is deposit and other is withdraw.Then select withdrawThen again  you will have two choices one is crypto other is fiat.You have to choose fiatThen click on withdraw fiat to bank accountNow click on preferred currencyFill out the amountClick on withdrawConfirm itWithdrawal process complete.It's your first post and your account is pretty new as it was created today. However, the strange thing I noticed is that you're claiming that people are asking the question that how to withdraw money from crypto.com, and I'm not sure who are those people that are asking such questions?However, if you posted this in order to guide others about the usage of the activity then nothing is wrong in posting such guides, but instead of presenting it in that way, you could easily name it as a tutorial to withdraw money from crypto.com, that way people who might get trouble in withdrawing their money from the site would find it valuable.It's your first post and still you're trying to help the users. That's a really good thing, welcome to the forum! In this forum you'll find the experts of Bitcoin and crypto enthusiasts. You should visit different board of the forum to learn more about it. Best of luck!

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Just as you searched and found out the process to withdraw funds from that platform any one else that actually wants to withdraw from the platform can just also do a simple search like that and get the answers they seek it's that easy. Maybe people are questioning how they can withdraw their funds from that platform but as far as this forum is concerned I haven't seen any of such question so far, you can actually link a place you have seen it previously, I have nothing against the guide but you should first wait for such question then reply the post or comment with such guide.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Is there even any platform that still needs special explanations for people on how to withdraw their funds? So far as I know, platforms and exchanges these days are built in such a way that an average person who knows how to read and understand any language could be able to use any exchange. If they don't understand the difficult language, they can manually change it to any language they will understand. Never the less, thanks for the tips on how to withdraw; we never know if anyone might actually need this some day, and when they do, they might actually come across this post and solve their problem.

comments.author: mendace
comments.body: I understand that this is your first post and you would like to help but I would not start by saying how to make a withdrawal from a CEX, on the contrary you really advise against using centralized exchange platforms because sooner or later they will all end up the same.  Rather start buying from bisq and keep everything in your private keys.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: mendace on May 16, 2023, 04:52:36 PMI understand that this is your first post and you would like to help but I would not start by saying how to make a withdrawal from a CEX, on the contrary you really advise against using centralized exchange platforms because sooner or later they will all end up the same.  Rather start buying from bisq and keep everything in your private keys.I will like to correct two things about OP despite being a newbie here, first is to desist from investing on alts, make use of a decentralized exchanges and lastly to remain careful not to reveal their security details to a third party, then this discu is all about exchanges, this should be posted on the board for exchanges, it will make more meaning having this discussion moved to the appropriate place, not your keys not your coins.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: mendace on May 16, 2023, 04:52:36 PMI understand that this is your first post and you would like to help but I would not start by saying how to make a withdrawal from a CEX, on the contrary you really advise against using centralized exchange platforms because sooner or later they will all end up the same.  Rather start buying from bisq and keep everything in your private keys.I guess he is a promoter of crypto.com. Maybe he was paid to do this publicity. If this post was just OP's contribution to the forum, then it shows that he needs to read more and post less. I know that some newbies are well-grounded in the crypto space but I expect every newbie in the industry to take time and learn about the forum before making any post. I have seen many threads where newbies complain of not having merits and this kind of post is one of the reasons for such an experience. Almost everyone in this forum is aware of the dangers of CEX, especially after the fall of many perceived reputable ones last year.

comments.author: UchihaSarada
comments.body: You can withdraw your coins from crypto.com successfully now but in future, you might not succeed.Reminder: do not keep your money in online accountsUse non custodial wallets.[LIST] Open Source Hardware Wallets[General] Bitcoin Wallets - Which, what, why?[LIST] Wallets supporting Taproot

comments.author: bayu7adi
comments.body: Quote from: Fiatless on May 16, 2023, 05:42:26 PMI guess he is a promoter of crypto.com. Maybe he was paid to do this publicity. If this post was just OP's contribution to the forum, then it shows that he needs to read more and post less. I know that some newbies are well-grounded in the crypto space but I expect every newbie in the industry to take time and learn about the forum before making any post. I have seen many threads where newbies complain of not having merits and this kind of post is one of the reasons for such an experience. Almost everyone in this forum is aware of the dangers of CEX, especially after the fall of many perceived reputable ones last year. Maybe yes, maybe no. However, I suspect that this account is primarily meant for creating backlinks from the Bitcointalk forum to the owner's personal website, accountiod.com, as indicated in their posts. The account was established at 5:52 UTC, followed by the creation of this post at 5:53 UTC, and eventually going offline at 06:03 UTC. Yes, they created the account solely to post something beneficial for their website, and then abandoned it.This strategy is highly advantageous for the targeted website, as it obtains free forum backlinks. In the realm of SEO (Search Engine Optimization), this approach is often employed by spamming various forums within the same niche and embedding links to their money-making site to boost their Domain Authority.It is evident that the quality of the content on the website surpasses that of the forum posts. Typically, at this stage, writers tend to take shortcuts in producing substantial material to expedite the backlinking process. I am well acquainted with this method, as I have studied several SEO techniques to strengthen websites or articles created on personal websites.QuoteA backlink is a hyperlink from a website or forum to a target website. Its purpose is to enhance the target website's authority in the eyes of Google, enabling it to achieve a higher ranking on search engine result pages.

comments.author: Zanab247
comments.body: I don't think, this is the first thing for you to learn from cryptocurrency because many that started with this procedure end up in a regret because they played with their resources. Why can't you use this period to learn how to buy cryptocurrency from the market and store them in your wallet before focusing on how to withdraw money from crypto.com. since you are a newbie, it will be difficult for people to follow this your steps because this is your first post in the Bitcointalk.org which many people will still doubt your experience in that aspect in the community.

comments.author: Ataiwo913
comments.body: To withdraw money from your Crypto.com account, follow these steps:1. Open the Crypto.com app or website and log in to your account.2. Navigate to the "Withdraw" section.3. Select the cryptocurrency you want to withdraw.4. Enter the amount you want to withdraw and the destination address.5. Confirm the withdrawal and any associated fees.6. Enter any necessary two-factor authentication codes or other security measures.7. Submit the withdrawal request.Once your withdrawal request has been processed, the cryptocurrency will be sent to the destination address you specified. The time it takes for the withdrawal to be processed can vary depending on the cryptocurrency and the network traffic at the time. It's always a good idea to double-check the destination address before submitting the withdrawal request to ensure that the cryptocurrency is sent to the correct place.

comments.author: zanezane
comments.body: Quote from: jiya83095 on May 16, 2023, 05:53:37 AMThe main question asked these days are “how to withdraw money from crypto.com?”The procedure is given below in steps form.I think its very rare to find asking questions like that, since its your first post maybe try reading some of the topics here where you can interact with. If you are trying to promote crypto.com (Ive seen a reply that maybe you are promoting it), atleast introduce yourself maybe some of the members here recognize you. and also Thank you for that information and welcome to the bitcointalk community. Try to explore more if you are not familiar with the forum yet.
